cleaned_text: COVID -19Vaccine Facts VACCINES PROTECT FROM THE WORST OUTCOMES OF COVID. VACCINES ARE AVAILABLE FOR EVERYONE EVERYONE 6 MONTHS AND OLDER SHOULD GET AT LEAST ONE UPDATED COVID -19 VACCINE DOSECOVID -19 vaccines reduce your risk of getting very sick from COVID -19, ending up in the hospital, or dying . It also lowers your risk of getting long COVID . The Pfizer and Moderna COVID -19 vaccines have been updated to protect against more recent variants of the virus . COVID -19 vaccines are free even if you don't have insurance. You will not be asked about your immigration status. Note: The original Novavax vaccine is available for people age 12+ and as a booster for people ages 18+ in some situations . The J&J vaccine is no longer available in the U.S. Free This information is based on: http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/media/Coronavirus/docs/vaccine/VaccineFacts.pdf Anyone ages 6 years and older who already got an updated vaccine dose is up to date. The following people may get additional doses: o Adults ages 65 years or older can get a second updated dose, at least 4 months after their first updated dose. o People who are immunocompromised can get additional updated doses. Talk to your doctor about what schedule is best for you. People who are unvaccinated should get ONE dose of updated vaccine now. People who are vaccinated but have not had an updated vaccine should get one at least 2 months after their last vaccine dose. Children ages 6 months through 5 years may need multiple doses of vaccine, including at least one updated dose. The number of doses depends on their age and which vaccine(s) they already received. Everyone should get vaccinated even if they are pregnant or breastfeeding or have had COVID -19. For more information about COVID- 19 vaccines, please visit the CDC and Vaccinate ALL 58! websites.HOW TO GET A VACCINE To find a location for vaccination, you can: Visit covid -19.acgov.org/ vaccines.page or call (510) 268- 2101 Call 2- 1-1 or ask your doctor or local pharmacist Some sites are open weekends and evenings and don't need an appointment. Free transportation and in- home vaccination are available. Minors need consent from their parent or legal guardian to get vaccinated. SERIOUS SIDE EFFECTS ARE RARE. Side effects are a sign that your immune system is building protection. They may affect your ability to do some daily activities but should go away within a day or two of getting vaccinated. Common side effects include: Pain, swelling and redness where the vaccine was given Joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, fever, chills, headache, and feeling tired Young children: crying, fussiness, sleepiness, and loss of appetite. Serious side effects are rare. COVID -19 VACCINES ARE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE. You cannot get COVID -19 from the vaccine. None of the vaccines contain the virus that causes COVID -19. Since December 2020, hundreds of millions of people have safely received a COVID -19 vaccine. The vaccine has been carefully studied, including in people of color, older adults, children and people with medical conditions and found to be safe and effective . COVID -19 vaccines continue to go through the most intensive safety monitoring in U.S. history. There is no evidence that COVID -19 vaccines cause fertility problems. They are safe for pregnant people and are recommended by pregnancy experts.COVID -19Vaccine Facts This
